intro: Hibbertia fasciculata f. adunca, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with five petals, typically arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open forests or heathlands. This variety is notable for its compact growth habit and ornamental value in gardens.
